bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 41 (Thursday, March 8, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. HECK:H.R. 5216.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:United States Constitution, Article I, Section 8: TheCongress shall have power . . . To regulate commerce withforeign nations, and among the several states, and with theIndian tribes;[Page H1502]

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

item.text:
Directing Implementation of Sanctions and Accountability for Russian Mischief Act or the DISARM Act

This bill directs the President to impose property-blocking and U.S. entry sanctions against certain senior Russian foreign political figures or oligarchs and parastatal entities (and associated individuals) not currently subject to sanctions.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: DISARM Act

item.title: To direct the President to impose sanctions on certain senior foreign political figures and oligarchs in the Russian Federation and certain Russian parastatal entities, and for other purposes.
Directing Implementation of Sanctions and Accountability for Russian Mischief Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
